skill.name: recover-from-errors
skill.tagline: Stay on track when tools fail by checking your plan first before trying fixes.
skill.summary: This skill helps you recover from errors without losing sight of your original goal. When a tool call fails, it guides you to check your plan to see if the action was actually required. This prevents you from guessing solutions that might take you off course.

workflow.mermaid:
graph TD
    A[Tool Call Fails] --> B{Check the Plan}
    B --> C[Verify Alignment]
    C --> D{Is action part of plan?}
    D -- Yes --> E[Analyze & Fix Specific Issue]
    D -- No --> F[Stop & Re-read Plan]
    F --> G[Get Back on Track]

steps.name: Check the Plan
steps.description: Immediately look up the session's plan file to understand the context of the current operation.

steps.name: Verify Alignment
steps.description: Determine if the failed tool call is actually required by the current step in the plan.

steps.name: Re-align to the Plan
steps.description: If the action is part of the plan, fix the specific issue. If not, stop and get back to the specified tasks.

principles: Prevent goal drift by avoiding guesses when tools fail
Always verify if a failing action is required by the plan before attempting fixes
Stop and re-read the plan if you've drifted from the specified tasks
